text: Hi all expert  for cimb promotion  I noticed if you deposit above 75 000  interest drop. I have 1 021 SGD as of 31 Aug. Does it mean I can top up 74 000 SGD to get 3.5%? Tq in advance
You will incurred 3% platform fee if your payment is above 200 rmb. And plus the forex spread😂
But I top up the sum yesterday.. how to check if qualify?

I set a recurring transfer to my EGA on my UOB one account for $2000 on the 1st of every month. This month the transaction did not happen on the 1st as it is a Sunday but it didn’t happen on Monday as well.I manually transferred the $2000 but it has now ruined my plan to keep $1000 MAB.Did it happen to somebody else as well or is it a peculiarity of UOB One account I’m not aware of?
Can advice if I buy air tickets from SQ but in foreign currency using Amaze. Will it consider as local spend or overseas spend?
It will be considered a local online spend as Amaze will convert it using their exchange rate to SGD

Seems like a HSBC issue lol. Better to self transfer if 11am they haven't process. That's the timing they usually process my recurring transfers anyway.
Not aware can search sms  thank you 🙏

Hi all for hsbc ega  how does the 30 days fresh fund work? Assuming if I have just started this month and deposited $10k..the next day I withdraw $6k and the following day I redeposit back $20k...What will be my fresh fund?
Will my fresh fund still be considered as $24k? Please advise

I could answer that. But unless u intend to ask every month  learning to figure it out would be more beneficial. The community here will be glad to help you check your answer 😁To start @mttelegrammthas shown us before how to do it herehttps://t.me/HoneyMoneySG/217619
May i ask why "151000" and not 150000?
1k is way overkill i guess. I put 600 in on first of every month to have like a 4  days buffer. Means even if the month ends with a 4 days holiday/non-banking days  it still works.
Just based on t&c  24k is "fresh".

Hi may I check if anyone still keep track of UOB Lady’s Card signup promotion? I can’t remember clearly or find anywhere what was their April’24 signup promo. I called in and ask they also don’t know. Lmao!
Dont they count by MAB of the month compared to previous month? Shdnt he count using the average of his end daily balances?
Based on t&c  the "fresh funds" MAB is calculated after determining what is considered "fresh funds".

Actually I always wondered what’s the actual percentage of HSBC EGA participants who actually end up getting the promised 3.x% + 1%.Clearly the tncs are not easy to navigate and spread out over more than 1 documents. Also it is intentionally (in my view) confusing and not easy to understand. Also I feel it is not easy to teach someone to follow exactly.Suspect the product manager team is smart to make it such that not everyone will get what’s promised due to ownself mess up. And this is why the program is still sustainable.Otherwise I am unsure how they can sustain the payout rate.Like Uob finally surrender and killed off amaze + Uob.

Hi experts out here  I deposited 500 on first of this month for my OCBC360 acc. Today go in check my ABD is showing as 252.33 instead 🧐Things noted was transaction date for the 500 FAST transfer was on 1st sep but value date is at 2nd sep. Do anyone know why it wasn’t anywhere near 500?This is the 2nd month though  first month (late Aug) I open the account and put 100k - salary not credited in on that month  received an interest of 2.46 for that month though 😅

Kerry sorry  hoping on this toosay we deposit 2k for salary to 360. for the Save component  i'd like to confirm  we still have to add another 500 on top of the 2k to increase the monthly average balance by 500 from the previous month?
2k salary can contribute to 500 save component. I usually withdraw out and leave just enough for 500 increase.
thanks Anthony! a follow up question.. i used the calculator on the 360 page and set ADB to be 1 000 and checked off the Salary and Save components  it's roughly 3.28%. how does one get 4.05%?
Becos you get different interest rate at higher/different ADB tiers. Try keying in 100k for ADB. U will see the 4.05%
3.28% for first 75k. You put 100k the result will be different.

Just to note  ur 2k is not "deposit" by yourself. Becos it wont work  unless its by corporate account deposited as salary.Individual days of incremental amount doesnt equate to the actual increase in the ADB. U need to calculate your ADB like thishttps://t.me/HoneyMoneySG/217619

no card rebate  dun count to min spend  dun count to card spend for one account bonus interest
